title: Ticket #713: CCB does not honor TCP_FORWARDING_HOST
description:
Matt noticed that if a CCB client has TCP_FORWARDING_HOST that the reversed connection attempt to the client goes to the client's private address, not its TCP_FORWARDING_HOST address.

While working with Marquette, we also found that the CCB server's TCP_FORWARDING_HOST is not propagated to the CCB listener's advertised CCB address.
remarks:
2009-Sep-15 05:36:28 by matt:
Looks like CCB doesn't honor TCP_FORWARDING_HOST...

Seems CCB will ask an exec node on a private network to connect to a private IP.

08/19 19:42:02 CCBListener: received request to connect to NEGOTIATOR <24.90.251.184:40012> on <192.168.77.42:40163> with reverse connect address <192.168.77.42:40012>, request id 204.

Negotiator is on private 77.42 and has TCP_FORWARDING_HOST set to 24.90.251.184, which does port forwarding so anyone can connect to it.

CCB should ask the exec node to connect to the TCP_FORWARDING_HOST.

2009-Nov-18 11:05:31 by danb:
I put a fix for this in 7.4.1.
